pronunciation: DROPSY, [L, Gr., water; the face. Formerly written hydropisy; whence by contraction, dropsy ]

definitions.text: In medicine, an unnatural collection of water, in an part of body, proceeding from greater effusion of serum exhalant arteries, than absorbents take up. It occurs most frequently in persons of lax habits, in bodies debilitated disease. The takes different names, according to part affected; as ascites, of abdomen; hydrocephalus, in head; anasarca, watery swelling over whole body; etc.
